text: Westminster Bridge is a road traffic and foot bridge over the River Thames between Westminster and Lambeth, in London. It is right next to the Houses of Parliament. ==History== Until Westminster Bridge was built in 1750, there was only one bridgeBefore 1750, London Bridge was the only bridge across the Thames. crossing the River Thames.Thames Diamond Jubilee Pageant, Key facts ; retrieved 2012-6-3. In June 2012, the bridge was highlighted on the route of Queen Elizabeth II's Diamond Jubilee Pageant on the Thames.Londontown.com, "Thames Jubilee Pageant,"; retrieved 2012-6-4. ==Related pages == * List of crossings of the River Thames ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * Interactive Panorama: Westminster Bridge Category:Bridges in London Category:Buildings and structures in the City of Westminster Category:Transport in the City of Westminster Category:Buildings and structures in the London Borough of Lambeth Category:Transport in the London Borough of Lambeth Category:Steel bridges Category:Grade II* listed buildings in London
title: Westminster Bridge
